Solicitation Title: Armed Overwatch Stores Management/Weapons Control System
Description Text:
The United States Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) and Air Force Special Operations Command are issuing this sources-sought announcement as part of a market survey. This Request For Information (RFI) is being sought for options to potentially replace/upgrade to the current Armed Overwatch (OA-1K) Stores Management System/Weapons Control System (SMS/WCS). 

The L3Harris OA-1K is an American fixed-wing, single-engine Light Attack/Armed Reconnaissance military aircraft that is commercially-derived from the Air Tractor AT-802U. It is being built for the USSOCOM Armed Overwatch program.  The OA-1K uses a SMS/WCS to employ a variety of weapons effectively and accurately.

Notice of Intent: As part of the terms of a lease agreement, the USDA, ARS, SEA intends to award a sole source procurement to Farm Air Inc., 11220 E Bricker Hwy, Astoria, IL 61501-8882. As the owner of the leased aircraft it is Farm Air's intent to have Covington Aircraft, Turbine Division, Airport Rd. HGR 600, Okmulgee, OK 74447 complete this repair. This is for the replacement of a failed engine of Air Tractor 402B with an overhauled PT6A-34 engine. Pursuant to the authority of 41 U.S.C. 253(c)(1) and FAR 6.302-1, Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services will satisfy agency requirements. Specifically, this particular service is required: (1) overhauled engine must contain Pratt & Whitney parts, (2) overhauled engine has zero time since overhaul, (3) vendor installs engine in aircraft, (4) vendor checks engine after installation to determine if it is working properly, and (5) vendor must provide a comprehensive and easy to understand warranty for the overhauled engine, its parts, and installation.. To meet the research project initiatives, the aircraft must be repaired by May 1, 2019. The Government intends to award a firm fixed price Purchase Order on or about April 15, 2019, using Simplified Acquisition Procedures. This Notice of Intent is not considered a Request for Quotation (RFQ) nor is it a Request for Proposals (RFP). No solicitation document is available and telephone requests will not be honored. Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to this requirement. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed contract based on responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. The Government will consider all responses received by 1:00 pm, cst, April 12, 2019. Information received will be considered solely for determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. Inquiries should be sent to huron.virden@ars.usda.gov.; or mailed to the Contracting Officer at the following address:Contracting Office Address:USDA-ARS-SEAP.O. BOX 225Stoneville, MS. 38776-0225
NAICS Title: Aircraft Engine and Engine Parts Manufacturing
SAM Organization Name: USDA ARS SEA AAO ACQ/PER PROP

Solicitation Title: NOTICE OF INTENT TO SOLE SOURCE AIRPLANE REPAIR
Description Text:
Notice of Intent: The USDA, ARS, WBSC intends to award a sole source procurement to Air Tractor Inc., P.O. Box 485, Leland Snow Way, Olney, TX 76374, as they are the sole source for this type of service pursuant to the authority of 41 U.S.C. 253(c)(l ) and FAR 6.302-1, Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements. The award will be for the inspection/diagnostic and necessary repairs of a damaged Air Tractor model 402B airplane airframe to correct the damage in order to make an air worthy airframe. Air Tractor is the manufacturer of the airplane and is the only company that has the knowledgeable personnel to conduct inspections and is certified to make the necessary repairs for the Air Tractor. Additionally, some parts will be required to be milled and Air Tractor is the only company that has access to the specifications. Specifically, the following items will be considered, but work is not limited to these items: 1. Inspection for repairs2. Material and service to repair the wings.3. New propeller.4. Painting, welding, etc...5. TestingThe Government intends to award a firm fixed Purchase Order on or about August 30, 2018. This Notice of Intent is not considered a Request for Quotation (RFQ) nor is it a Request for Proposals (RFP). No solicitation document is available and telephone requests will not be honored. Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to this requirement. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed contract based on responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. The Government will consider all responses received by 4:30PM central time, August 29, 2018. Information received will be considered solely for determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. Inquiries will only be accepted via e-mail to the Contracting Officer at the following address:
Contracting Office Address: USDA-ARS-WBSC Attn: Joseph Covarrubio, Contract Specialist1001 Holleman Dr. East College Station, TX 77840Joseph.covarrubio@ars.usda.gov
